pullRequest.body:
1. order isomorphism between congruence on group and opposite groups
2. congruence relation is preserved by finite product/sum

---

```suggestion
    exact c.mul (h _ <| .head _) <| ih fun k hk â†¦ h _ (.tail _ hk)

/-- Multiplicative congruence relations preserve product indexed by a multiset. -/
@[to_additive "Additive congruence relations preserve sum indexed by a multiset."]
protected theorem multiset_prod {Î¹ M : Type*} [CommMonoid M] (c : Con M) {s : Multiset Î¹}
    {f g : Î¹ â†’ M} (h : âˆ€ x âˆˆ s, c (f x) (g x)) :
    c (s.map f).prod (s.map g).prod := by
  rcases s; simpa using c.list_prod h

/-- Multiplicative congruence relations preserve finite product. -/
@[to_additive "Additive congruence relations preserve finite sum."]
protected theorem finset_prod {Î¹ M : Type*} [CommMonoid M] (c : Con M) (s : Finset Î¹)
    {f g : Î¹ â†’ M} (h : âˆ€ i âˆˆ s, c (f i) (g i)) :
    c (s.prod f) (s.prod g) :=
  c.multiset_prod h
```

```suggestion
protected theorem finsetProd {Î¹ M : Type*} [CommMonoid M] (c : Con M) (s : Finset Î¹)
```

Sorry, forgotten about this PR.

I think the "finsetProd" spelling is very uncommon, with only [4 results](https://loogle.lean-lang.org/?q=%22finsetProd%22) in mathlib. On the other hand "finset_prod" returns [90 results](https://loogle.lean-lang.org/?q=%22finset_prod%22).

maintainer merge

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(GroupTheory/Congruence/*): add some missing lemma and constructions of group congruence

source.title: feat(RingTheory/Congruence): interpret `RingCon` as two sided ideals
